Reviews.Title: “Lovely home out of home”
Reviews.Author: youricat
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Jia 2x this year. First was in March in the Suite room and the second stay was a month or two after in the studio. One of the many reasons why I chose to stay here for the 2nd time was because of my daughter of 5 y/0. She was happy and contented, feeling at home as we can bring take away from any restaurant nearby and eat in as if we were at home and she could play to her delight. She loved going down to toast her bread in the morning as breakfast is served at the lobby, family style. Jia was inviting due to the location (nearby restaurants and shopping - SOGO, and many other shops were a stone's throw away) and cozy touch. Although the rooms were good, we find it a bit too dark and the bathrooms were too crowded. Although bed is comfortable, it is too small. The concept of having free flowing breakfast, fruits, snack and drinks is great and enticing. Since it is located in the busy area of CWB, naturally there was no view from the window which is understandable. Although staff looked nice, they were not the typical very warm and friendly type unless you start a conversation running perhaps. They are not bashful but just ok and efficient. I've recommend this hotel to my friends and would not hesitate to come back if the price is right. I feel it is a bit overpriced especially this season!

Reviews.Title: “One of the better hotels”
Reviews.Author: h3k1
Reviews.Content: Stay here for one night while in transit. Booked into a suite and first impression when I walked in was WOW! I've stay in various hotels in HK before, but this one sure blew me away. The staff were friendly and knowledge able of HK. Location of hotel is another bonus, sitting in the center of Causeway Bay with an MTR exit F that is less than 5 mins away, can't go wrong with that! Great restaurant all long the way back to the hotel, and an 7-11 right across the street that offer hot food! The hotel offer a very relax and laid back environment. I would definitely book into J Plus again on my return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MBen79
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the J-Plus hotel and had a fantastic time. The staff couldn't do enough to help us, they were all extremely friendly and nothing was too much trouble. They make you feel like you are part of a big family. This is also apparent in the little 'extras' that they offer in the lobby each day including a continental breakfast, coffee/tea, soft drinks, cake and wine from 6pm to 8pm each evening. The set up and furniture encourages you to relax in the lobby with the other guests, like you would in your own lounge room. We had a one bedroom suite, which was perfect with our 6 month old. The room included a kitchenette, lounge and dining area and there was ample space for the three of us. It was more like an apartment than a hotel room. The kitchenette had all the basic items if you wanted to cook. The location is also great. It is very close to the Causeway Bay MTR station and is surrounded by quirky local eateries (including a Din Tai Fung across the road), cafes and fantastic shopping, whatever your budget! If you are staying with children, the hotel also offers a very reasonably prices baby sitting service.

Reviews.Title: “Great stauff and location.”
Reviews.Author: Sutbear
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location down the street from causeway bay mtr station the SOGO Department store just a minute away. The staff was very helpful. Room is neat and clean. Next trip to HKG, I surely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “When is the last time you clearly remembered a hotel room?”
Reviews.Author: Anya2010_10
Reviews.Content: If you travel reasonably frequently - when was the last time you could remember many details about a hotel room many months after your stay? I stayed at the Jia earlier this year - when it was still the Jia - and still remember it very clearly. Just as the name suggests (Jia is home in Mandarin) the rooms are more like your downtown pied-a-terre than a faceless hotel. It isn't the easiest place to find - as the external signage is very subtle - but the location is great - just minutes walk from the shops and metro at Causeway bay, and even better, just across the road from the fabulous Din Tai Fung dumpling restaurant. The rooms are a little bigger than usual hotel rooms, and ours had a small living room area and kitchen. Yes the sofa cushions could have done with a wash and yes the blinds in the shower were past their best, but it felt comfortable - a pleasant place to retreat from the frenetic energy of downtown HK. It also felt quite cosy - somewhere that deviated from the blandness of so many hotels. What contributed to the relaxed feel was the laid back lobby area where wine was available for guests to help themselves for much of the day. Breakfast worked on the same principle - you just help yourself to the coffee, rolls, fruit etc in the small kitchen. If you like the perfection of a super high end polished hotel, this might not be for you, but if you want somewhere convenient and just quirky enough that you'll remember it in the future - then it's definitely worth a try.

Reviews.Title: “Go J Plus!”
Reviews.Author: P H
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our first stop in our 14 day honeymoon in hong kong (and then Bali) and although we had a hard time finding it its a welcoming and clean spot. The staff was very helpful ESP. Since we arrived quite late in the evening(10 pm). Anita at the front desk helped us find a place to eat. Things close earlier than expected- unlike NYC. We enjoyed a suite on the 22 floor with a kitchenette, sitting room, spacious enough bathroom. Free wifi was also a plus! The AC worked well and were pleased. We only stayed one night but would reccomend this hotel (which was recommended to us by our friends). It's a short(2stop train ride) to Central or 10 min cab. if you're looking for a reasonable place to stay don't hesitate to book this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Just dont look out the window and you're all good!”
Reviews.Author: MsJiggsaw
Reviews.Content: It was a first trip for my husband and I without the kids so we were really looking forward to a great time in HK. The hotel (Named JIA when we stayed) was recommended by one of our friends and judging from the reviews we read, it was pretty much okay. Upon arriving at the airport, we were greeted by the concierge of the hotel who showed us to our limo. Driver was courteous and well dressed/well groomed. After zigzagging and a number of turns, we were at the hotel. Hmm, not that impressive looking from the outside. There was no car lobby either. But I was still optimistic since the location was near restaurants, malls and the MTR. Greeting us at the front desk (which was a very simple but chic table with a MAC), was a well groomed guy (oops, forgot to get his name), and checking in was such a breeze. Then we were whisked off to our suite. Oh, it was such a lovely room and I was tempted not to go out anymore! Well, as I said in my title, just don't open your curtains and you're in R&R paradise (minus the beach).

Reviews.Title: “Meh.”
Reviews.Author: erika824
Reviews.Content: I hated the fact that I had a hard time finding this hotel, but it was still a nice place to stay in Hong Kong. Not too thrilled about the location. Rooms were ok, modern furnishings and relatively clean. Bathrooms were a little musty.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotal”
Reviews.Author: toriper
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights and found JIA to be a great hotel. It is conveniently located although taxi drivers are not very familiar with it. Better to say you are going to the Regal hotel which is across the street. It also has drinks available all day in the lobby which include water and a variety of fruit juices. The continental buffet breakfast is good enough but could include a few more items. I was lucky enough to get an upgrade and enjoyed the one bedroom type suite. It includes a kitchenette and would be great for families. The staff were very helpful and accommodating and I was able to get late check-out as well. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Laid Back Style”
Reviews.Author: MartyNZ
Reviews.Content: Once you find it (we walked past it twice as the sign is so small) you'll be pleased you did. Located in the heart of Causeway Bay, you're as close to the action as you could possibly want to be. We caught the train from the airport to get a bit of local flavour and it was easy as. Taxis are cheap, so after a long flight you might want to take that option instead. Tell the driver that you're looking for the Hotel Regal (as they'll probably know that) and if you're facing the hotel, the Jia is on the other side of the street and to your left, right on the corner. If you can see the Drawing Room Restaurant, then you're there. We found the staff extremely helpful and knowledgable about places to eat and things to do. The room was incredibly big with a separate kitchen and dining area. Breakfast was continental and the dining areas lend themselves to meeting your fellow guests, everything from MCs to shoe manufacturers seem to stay here. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AbsolutelyFabulous1
Reviews.Content: Near MTR and within easy walking distance to Times Square and other shopping. Buffet breakfast in the lobby was convenient, with all coffees, juice, water bottles available at all times, afternoon tea was probably great, as well as the aperitifs, but we are never there! We did notice a few dust bunnies, and the shower blinds in our suite needed replacing, but it was comfortable and clean and we loved the furniture (Frank Gehry's Wiggle Wiggle chair in our room etc) The reception staff were very helpful. Great value for the price; I would definitely stay here again. There was a kitchenette with fridge and microwave too.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant but getting rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: zoedodger
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Jia for two nights in April 2012 and for four nights in October 2010. On both visits I was on my own and travelling for pleasure. On the positive side, the Jia is nicely located in Causeway Bay, near both trams and trains (though taxis are soooo inexpensive in HK, I only occasionally used either). The rooms are very comfortable and have many useful amenities: iPod dock, dvd players (with movies at reception), kitchenette, separate lounge space. The decor is fairly classic Philippe Starck with clean lines, troll stools and lots of white and silver (with a touch of yellow). When the hotel first opened, I'm sure the rooms were stunning and an excellent value. There is a nice terrace (with laundry facilities), a pleasant bar, and a restaurant on site. As a single woman, I felt perfectly safe at all times both in the hotel and in the surrounding neighborhood. So far so good. On the less positive side, the problem with minimalist, clean, white rooms is it takes a lot of effort to keep them looking so pristine, and the Jia is definitely now showing a fair amount of wear and tear. In the 18 months since I last visited, the hotel and my room definitely looked a bit less fresh. Secondly, there are only two small lifts servicing the whole hotel, and I found at certain peak periods the wait to get up/down was frustratingly long (especially when the lift would just pass your floor altogether without stopping). Finally, the breakfast is fine but uninspiring. Everything is laid out nicely enough in the lobby, but it does seem a bit crowded at times (you can end up eating your food in your lap), and the food on offer is fairly pedestrian i.e. muffins, yoghurt, juice and coffee. The queue for the coffee maker was also a bit trying at times. Would I return again? Maybe. I like the rooms, and if I were assured of getting one that didn't look too worn and could get a good price, I would visit again. But for the price I paid on the last visit, I'm not sure the value proposition is quite as good as it used to be (higher price for more worn hotel). Still, all in all, a good boutique-y hotel experience. Just work to get a good price on the room so as to get your money's worth. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “location”
Reviews.Author: morisabravaya
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights during one of the busiest times in HK. I think it was a fair price. Location is great. 1 minute by foot to the tram. 10 minutes by taxi or 1 stop by metro to the HKCEC. 5 minutes by foot to shopping malls (times square etc). Other than location, the rest is just OK. And if you stay at the suit, it spacious compared to other 5* hotels in HK. Bring your own food for breakfast -except the French- they have croissant, jam and coffee! The complementary bar at the reception (24/7) is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Jai Hotel,fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Adrian J
Reviews.Content: My wife and I will be sorry to leave the Jai tomorrow morning,initially the rooms seemed a little small but they are amazingly clean and functional.The staff here are what really made our stay enjoyable,they are friendly,helpful and obviously very happy working here.The free Internet,water and breakfast all make you very comfortable and we would have no hesitation in recommending the Jai to anyone visiting HK. We,ll certainly be staying here again. Adrian and Michele

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Natalie R
Reviews.Content: Jia was inspiring. Clean fresh design ... Although a bit cold but comfortable Good staff. Breakfast could have been better. Overall would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and functional”
Reviews.Author: nayal b
Reviews.Content: I loved the JIa hotel because it was in cosway bay relaxing place and can go shopping till 3 in the morning and partying till whatever then come back to this hotel with a lovely suite beautiful it was but it was small it was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Happy family”
Reviews.Author: ahlai
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the suite for 5 days. Travelled with a 4 yar old and 8 month old. Trip from airport was roughly 25 mins cost us bout hkd 400. The taxi driver was typically grouchy and was nagging bout us having to stop at the side of the road opposite the hotel etc, but beneath all that he came down (still nagging) took out 2 strollers, crossed the st and helped us! Reception staff were great throughout, courteous and informative. The room size is definitely a plus, similar to buying a one room studios apartment,a small kitchen area, a big work desk with lots of sockets, a sofa, a daybed in the hall,and a little hidden corner with another daybed( where I positioned the baby cot and slept with the baby) and a proper dining table for 4. And then there is the room with a queen sized bed. Lots of closet area. Decently cleaned rooms everyday, replenishment of amentities were excellent. A little complain though..the shower does need some tweaking.head was very small and you do have to do some jumping jacks when the water turns hot and cold at its own will. My baby wasn't trilled, he was screaming at bath time at all times even though I brought an inflatable tub for him. I would also say the lightning is pretty dim, romantic for couples but maybe a little dark for children who may find it too "moody". But it wasn't a major thing, my 4year old loves it with or without the lights. The space was great for her. We were fortunate enough to get a room which other reviewers have experienced (dirty linen, dirty walls,etc) ours was well maintained and we left we made sure it looked the same. The mini bar at the lobby was great with bottled water,juices and coffee available all day and cakes at certain hrs.breakfast was great for us, fresh fruits and pastries and breads. Always fresh. Laundry service on the rooftop area is great. Was surprised its free. With detergent and softener provided. That you very much JIa, that is great service and it didn't cost an arm or leg at all. My daughter wanted my husband to buy one room from JIa to make it her holiday home.Ha! Traffic noise can be pretty loud if you have a sleeping baby, it is in the midst of the city..especially on weekends when drivers get impatient and vent their frustrations with the honk. We were staying on the 22 floor, there are 23 floors. But you can't beat the noise youngest from places like new York where you hear sirens every few minutes, it eventually becomes part of the room.. So it was ok. Food and shopping is not a problem at all. Great DIn Tai FUng is just across the streets andnlotsbof little shops for local food. Small night market just next to the hotel. Lazy to go out? Just order a takeout. Easy. All in all, it was a great place for us, to stay, to relax and even to play. And yes we will come back again. I do hope the new owners take some time to do some touch ups, but definitely to maintain the standard of service and make it a home away from home. A gem!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Friendly serivce”
Reviews.Author: D Y
Reviews.Content: Jia is at a great location - near transport, shopping and restaurants in Causeway Bay. Interior design is model and comfortable, though the rooms are a bit on the small side. Friendly staff and complimentary drinks a also a great draw card. Free shuttle bus service to the Airport Express station departs across the road the the Regal Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gloomy Designer Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mossil58
Reviews.Content: On the whole, I was slightly disappointed with the whole experience at jia. I feel I paid for the few designer touches in the hotel room and lobby. Otherwise, this would be a very average hotel. In addition, the rooms were abit tired and could do with some renovation work here and there. The lift lobbies on each floor could do with more lighting too! Besides the great location, I probably would not consider staying at jia again. Travel tip: If you are taking the MTR from the airport, take exit F from causeway bay station and walk towards the general direction of Sogo. There's a lovely street of food right next to the hotel. Try out Mak's noodles and this local yakitori store in one of the small lanes. Perfect supper food!

Reviews.Title: “More like service apartment than hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rodrigo N
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Jia. The hotel lobby: The desk hotel is very small and don't look very nice, the lounge have nice furnitures. The breakfast is poor and have only a big table to share for all guests. The service and staff: The service was good and the staffs were friendly and helpful. Location: is great, in the heart Causeway Bay and close the subway! The room: We book one suite, the suite have a nice small kitchen, where u can cook,as i said look like service apartment. The decoration is not very modern, and looks tired. The windows are very dirty, the bathroom are very small and not bathtub. A night i went to shower and the shower its not working and very dirty water. The bed is very uncomfortable. The room look so dark,smell and the curtains look dirty. They need urgent a upgrade this hotel or change for service apartment type, because don't look boutique hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “"Comfortable! Wonderful! and Excellent!"”
Reviews.Author: M A
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for my fd from US for his 4 days trip to Hong Kong. He commented JIA is so GREAT!!!!!! "Comfortable! Wonderful! and Excellent!" He appreciated the hotel design and the convenient location, just 4 minutes fr the MTR station. He asked me to book him the hotel again next time when he comes to HK =] Found it website changed to http://www.jplushongkong.com/en/ HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful value! I'd stay again!”
Reviews.Author: samanthaonstyle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Jia for our first visit to Hong Kong, a week-long stay that included both work and vacation. Overall, it was a wonderful room, location, and value, and I would definitely stay again on a future trip to Hong Kong. ROOM: We booked a suite, since we had a long stay and wanted space to work and relax. The suite was perfect for two. It's laid out like an apartment and feels very spacious, with the added benefit of Philippe Starck decor. There is a huge living space with a desk, comfortable living room, and even a full dining set and kitchenette. There's tons of closet space, too, and a clean, comfortable bedroom. If you have a long stay, it's nice to be able to relax in your room, keep breakfast in the kitchen, order delivery and watch a movie, etc. BATHROOM: The bathroom was a Westernized bathroom, all white marble with a glass-enclosed shower (no tub). There's a decent amount of storage space in the medicine cabinet and on the sink, though only one person can fit in the bathroom at a time. Also, the hot water was very limited, but wasn't a major problem. HOUSEKEEPING/STAFF: The housekeeping did a good job. The bathroom was clean enough, but could have used a bleach job, and we had to pile the towels up outside the bathroom to get them replaced every day, but I had no real complaints. The laundry prices were reasonable and they did a fine job. The staff was friendly and helpful with getting us a taxi to the airport. AMENITIES: The Jia offers a great free "mini bar" in the hotel lobby, with soft drinks, coffee, tea, and water bottles available all day/night, as well as continental breakfast, a tea-time snack, and evening wine. We usually missed breakfast, but the spread included fresh fruit and pastries. The hotel has an on-site fitness room, which is small but has all you need. LOCATION: If you want to be on Hong Kong island, the location cannot be beat. It's two blocks from the Causeway Bay subway stop, and you can always get a taxi nearby. If you like to walk, you can walk almost anywhere, from the Mid-Levels and Hollywood Road, to Pacific Place in Admiralty, to the Convention Center in Wan Chai. There are a lot of great dining and shopping options close by in Times Square, too. VALUE: Overall, it's excellent value for Hong Kong, where hotels can be small and expensive. You'll get a clean, spacious, well-designed suite for a fraction of the price of basic rooms in the hotels on the Harbor, without any sacrifice in comfort or location. I highly recommend the Jia, and I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, design, and staff.”
Reviews.Author: ekiben_rule
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in a studio, at Chinese New year. Excellent room, very comfortable, with quirky but practical design. Great location 2 mins walk from the MTR station, and in an area with lots of local eateries as well as big malls with mid-level restaurants. Only slight downside was crowding at breakfast -- which was a very good continental breakfast with fresh fruits and good pastries. Also, its a bit hard to find because its sign is so obscure -- we were still looking for it while standing in front of it! Staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very charming and sexy hotel in prime location!”
Reviews.Author: Milocc
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very conveniently located amongst small eats, alley shopping and must importantly, steps away from the train stations. The rooms are very appealing and readonably sized. Efficient service but a little warmer approach would be perfect!!! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home”
Reviews.Author: jaczc
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite at the Jia for 3 nights over New Year's Eve. We were really pleased with how large and well equipped the place was with lots of comfy seating areas and a separate bedroom. It even had a fully equipped kitchen - we only used the kettle. Staff were all charming and very helpful and thankfully gave us a late check out on New Year's Day. The complimentary breakfast, soft drinks, afternoon cake, and evening wine all added to the fun and made us feel like we were staying in someone's house rather than a hotel. And of course the free wifi worked as promised. The location was good and easy to get around on the MTR, by taxi or just walking around. Would definitely stay here again and fear I may have to book suites any where else that I stay, having enjoyed the amount of space in this suite.

Reviews.Title: “Designed by Philipe Stark?”
Reviews.Author: Hotel_Guest293913
Reviews.Content: Is this really designed by Philipe Stark? The room was nice but the hotel has clearly cut corners. The window treatments in the shower were covered up by blinds. Very strange. The hotel staff were rude and uninviting. Their one saving grace was being able to make a reservation at a restaurant. The location is great but the hotel is hard to find and taxi drivers will not know where the hotel or the street is located. The room was also very noisy. Only stay here if you can't find something better.

Reviews.Title: “lives up to the name”
Reviews.Author: intsik
Reviews.Content: so i read in the website that the name jia is chinese for home, which is kind of what this place is. like a flashy loft your friend lent you for the weekend. got the suite which had a seperate bedroom. it was huge for hong kong standards ( website says 72 sq meters) which was nice since there were 3 adults in our group. it was great to be able to walk around and not bump into suitecases and shopping bags, which is very common in hong kong hotel rooms. the bedroom and bathroom were pretty small, but still functional. the kitchen was well equipped. the living and dining areas very spacious. the room could uise a refurbishment though. the couches where not comfortable as the cushions where overused and superthin. the blinds in the bathroom were a warped mess. the room was still kept nice and clean, but the both the rooms and hotel are showing definite wear and tear. the breakfast was a typical continental breakfast of fruit and bread. nothing fancy. the all-day open pantry was a nice, as we did not need to buy any drinks of snacks. basically the ground floor is the lobby area where people check in and have food. when it is hectic, it is very , very hectic, since it is tiny. if you want a typical hotel, jia is not for you. it does not have typical hotel amenities. if you dont mind sacrificing those for a little style, some peace and quiet, and a good amount of space, i'd come to jia.

Reviews.Title: “Still excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Teirrah
Reviews.Content: I originally came in 2005 and still return. Most recently for work. The hotel is stylish (of course, Philippe Starck), each room is well equipped with everything the traveller should want and is well located (right by Causeway Bay subway station – easy connections for Central, the airport and walking distance to the park for running or relaxing or Causeway Bay shopping). The small touches make all the difference: full and varied breakfast, complimentary wine between 5-8, free use of a full DVD library, the option for takeaway as well as room service, free wifi, a mini kitchen in each room, the list goes on… All for reasonable (for Hong Kong) price. If I were to change one thing, it might be, considering the location, the offer of complimentary airport pickups or a daily shuttle to Central. That said, I have returned several times and will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and very designer chic.”
Reviews.Author: Inertiareal
Reviews.Content: Selected for its design credentials, this hotel did not disappoint. The suite had everything and the staff (with one grumpy exception) were delightful in every way The breakfast, drinks, free calls etc were a bonus and its position across from a great dim sum restaurant and the Jardine market as well as a flash shopping precinct were a plus. Will happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: albiondxb
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the JIA in August. The hotel location is excellent and is only moments away from the MTR station. The room was perfect, decoration was modern and the shower was powerful. Importantly the room was clean and quiet. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful . Overall we were very impressed with the JIA and stayed again two weeks later on the return leg of our trip instead of staying in Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “A serious bolt hole in Downtown Hong Kong...”
Reviews.Author: Lyndon B
Reviews.Content: For our second visit to Hong Kong this year we tried something different on the recommendations of a business friend. Although off the beaten track, which took our driver ages to find. we found it to be perfect for the jar dine bazaar and lots of department stores and with trams and mini buses within easy reach at causeway bay station we explored the island effortlessly.. Our studio was wonderful, a functional kitchen and a perfectly adequate bathroom. We loved the designer touches and the curtain that split the room into two. We dined in the restaurant on the first floor on two evenings.. Intial reactions was that the menu was very expensive but after the chef finished service he came out and explained that nearly all the produce was flown in daily from France...so I did not mind paying for wonderful quality..the lounge bar was dark and trendy full of the hip and trendy that live in the area and the cocktail list was certainly different. overall a great bolt hole for exploring the island. One of my favourite boutique hotels

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Sarah F
Reviews.Content: I totally felt at home. Enjoyed every minute! Nestled in one of HongKong's busiest areas, Causeway Bay, it's every shopper and foodie's paradise. Within walking distance to all the great shopping neighbourhoods and the metro. The hi tech rooms are extremely stylish and comfortable. I stayed in a studio one for 10 days. Although small, it's good for one person max two. It lives up to what HongKong standards. High Rise, limited space. so you kinda feel like you've moved to HK. The lobby is rather unique with a small breakfast area. Philip Starck is written all over the hotel which pays extra attention to small details and lighting. The furniture speaks for itself. The hotel is right on the street so it's easy to miss if you go for the first time. The cab driver will drop you off on the street so better hurry stepping out/in. Don't expect it to be like other wellknown 4/5 star chains. If you expect swimming pools, gym, cafes and the typical hotel lobby, then this hotel is not for you. I'm coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: dcvoyagerThailand
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed three nights at the Jia Boutique Hotel on our way home from an extended trip to Indonesia. We arrived at 7 am and the hotel worked quickly to get us into an room by 10 am even though check in time is 2 pm. We had a studio, which was perfect for us. While small, the room is so carefully laid out that we didn't feel cramped. The location is great - a block from the Causeway Bay metro station on Hong Kong Island in a really interesting neighborhood. We found out too late that just across the street is a Taiwanese restaurant with one Michelin star. We were so tired from our travels that we ordered in from a local restaurant, a terrific service the hotel provides. The staff were generally very friendly and helpful (only one staff member was totally unhelpful when we asked for help in finding a place to eat.) The free drinks and snacks is also a nice touch. The hotel advertises that each room has a "fully equipped kitchen" but that is a stretch. We didn't mind as we had no plans to cook anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Was expecting more from a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Evie_chua
Reviews.Content: When people around me heard that I am putting up at JIA, HK - everyone is very excited and raved about it. My expectation was elevated. Upon arrival: Check in was smooth and swift. Hotel Lobby: Ambience is pretty good with free flow of drinks. This is especially handy when we needed water before/after our trip out/back to hotel.The free flow of wine from 6-8pm is a nice gesture and I must say the quality of the wine is quite acceptable. Room: It is poorly maintained. I see stains on almost all the white furniture like sofa, day bed, lounge bed etc. It is totally unacceptable to have stains in my opinion. Bed&Pillows: I cannot stand the pillow. It is of bad quality and even now, my neck still hurt. Bed is relatively acceptable but I didnt sleep well for all 3 nights. Toilet: I can see rust on the joints of door/wall. Toiletries are provided. Slippers and Robe: I like the japanese style bedroom slippers which are much more comfortable than most of those that other hotel provides. Breakfast: Bad selection and totally don't feel like eating Service: Excellent. Assist us with reservations and road directions. Venue: Perfect. near to MTR and it is very easy to get taxi just across the street. Unless they improved on the maintenance of the hotel, I wouldnt dare revisit the hotel for my next trip (probably in 1-2yrs' time - judging from the wear and tear condition.)

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lekky-rkl
Reviews.Content: I travelled as a couple to Hong Kong, this hotel is definitely the best for us regarding to its unique design and convenient location. There are free snacks and drinks at the lobby lounge plus free wifi throughout the hotel except at the restaurant. The studio room is well equipped and can accommodate only 2 persons, but it's big enough for us. Iphone/ipod docking station is such a great entertainment for me. Love it.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: travelalot064
Reviews.Content: Quite simply this property provide everything you would need for an extended stay in Hong Kong, the suite was well furnished, clean and functioned well, if your looking for 5 star, well this isn't the place for you but as a solid 4 star it works well. Positioned a short walk from causeway bay MTR , its easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Great for one or two, definitely not a family”
Reviews.Author: Pathcontrolmonk
Reviews.Content: While the rooms were compact they were well laid out. Apparently Philippe Starck just lent his name to the property and they put in a bunch of his furniture, but it used to be an old shabby apartment building that was renovated. Not sure if they still have continental breakfasts in the lobby, but was a great chance to socialize with other travelers. All in all, decent hotel but dont expect luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: xugrace
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Clean. Free wifi. Rooms a bit small but well appointed. Great location. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located & good sized studio room”
Reviews.Author: jasmine_yeo
Reviews.Content: Great in size and cozy room with sitting area & bed area partitioned by a curtain. Easily turn the TV to face the bed or the living room easily as it's a on swivel table. Good that the hotel has free flow of drinks all day, including wine in the evenings. Free wifi & helpful staff makes this a great location for business! Breakfast is simple, but serves its purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Botique Hotel which makes you feel at home”
Reviews.Author: Ramachandraniyer
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Jia in the second week of august for a week. The hotel has always been my favorite as it makes you feel at home after that long meetings that i have the whole day. The reception is pretty small but people out there are really helpful with anything that you need. The breakfast is great, they server fruits, juices and cold drinks for free throughout the day. The best is the cofee machine at the lobby gives you all kind's of different coffee. Does not have a restaurant. The room is of the right size (atleast what i think) and has everything to keep you occupied, Free internet, ipod dock, HDMI Dock for your phone. The room also has a small kitchen with all things you need to cook. I would always prefer to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel but Lacks Personal Touch”
Reviews.Author: YukonTales
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights here and was upgraded to a suite, which I was very grateful for. But the frontdesk service was incompatible with the whole of idea of personalised service that one would expect at a boutique hotel. At the time of check-in, which was about 5pm, I asked if there were "cha chan teng" in the area near the hotel (cha chan teng is the Hong Kong Style tea cafes). The staff told me they were everywhere. Not exactly a helpful answer. I then asked if they could recommend one as I wanted to grab something for dinner and I was told I could walk around and see which one I like. On subsequent days, I asked about certain meeting locations as I wanted to take a taxi and sometimes, the staff would offer to help hail a taxi, but sometimes they just said "go in this direction etc". This was an issue as JIA was located at the cross-junction of two narrow and busy streets, and it was extremely to get a taxi on your own, if a staff didn't get one of you. The hotel is about 15mins walk both from Times Square and Sogo. And there are many food places along Jardine's Bazaar, which is diagonally across the hotel. I went there for local breakfast everyday, as the continental breakfast in the hotel was kinda limited. There is also a Din Tai Fung Chinese restaurant right beside the hotel, if you are too lazy to walk around for dinner. The room is quirkly and funky, as you would expect from a Starck design. The suite I was in was styled as an apartment, which was very nice. But more upkeep would be needed as you could find pockets of dust, especially the AC units which were hidden in the wall.

Reviews.Title: “Different”
Reviews.Author: AnabelAmaya
Reviews.Content: A big fan of smaller, cosier boutique hotels rather than great hulking anonymous skyscrapers I booked my boyfriend and I into the Jia Boutique Hotel for a long weekend. Designed by Philippe Starck and sitting right in the ideal location of Causeway Bay, my expectations were high. The reality did not quite meet the expectation though. This was apparently one of the first ever boutique hotels ever to be opened in Hong Kong and unfortunately it does show: Whilst the rooms and all common areas were very clean, they were curling a little at the edges which for me took the shine off our stay. Also, the photos on the website do make the rooms look bigger than they actually are (surprise surprise) so we were very happy to have picked the basic suite over the basic standard room as the bedroom itself was very pokey. Would I recommend this place? For the price yes I would (we paid the equivalent of around GBP 200 a night which isnt bad for the location) but we did get the room on offer, I wouldnt pay much more for it and I wouldnt book it for a special occasion but if you're simply looking for somewhere reasonably economical to stay in a good part of town that's a little different then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, friendly designer hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoulouV
Reviews.Content: We booked this on the internet without any recommendation from friends or colleagues, always a risk. When we arrived, we felt we had struck gold. The service from start to finish could not have been friendlier and the hotel looked swish from the lobby right up to the last detail in the rooms. Although small, the rooms looked stunning and were very comfortable. There were ample facilities to make tea and coffee and a good mini-bar if required. The hotel bar was also very inviting with gorgeous complimentary peanuts with drinks. I would not normally comment on peanuts but these were extremely more-ish. We did not eat dinner in the restaurant however it was full on each of the three nights we were there. Complimentary breakfast is served in the downstairs lobby-restaurant and although very basic (fruit, yogurt, toast) it was fine, given we would eat out for all other meals. It is situated in the heart of Causeway Bay with lots of interesting eateries all around and ten minutes walk through lively street markets to the World Trade Centre - a ginormous shopping mall. A very lively part of town and, by HK standards, not too crowded. The concierges were all so very helpful and considerate, even down to running after cabs on a busy Saturday morning to ensure that we got to the airport on time. The only problem we had was that when we first arrived in Hong Kong, the taxi driver had never heard of the hotel. Make sure that you have the address in chinese before you go so that you can show the driver. Thoroughly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel but overall pretty average”
Reviews.Author: John_tripdadvisdor
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights and it was just ... ok. I did expect a lot more as i thought staying in a boutique hotel would give me a new experience. But was not greatly impressed. Staff were cold. Food was ok. Location was great. Beds were comfortable though!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, we would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: ravigoter
Reviews.Content: I can't speak enough about the helpfulness and friendliness of the staff here. Everyone was extremely courteous and eager to assist us. The rooms are spacious, includes couch, desk, and DVD player, with a library of movies in the lobby. There is also a microwave, cooking supplies, and a stove. The odd thing was that the TV is on a turntable in the middle of the room, so you can swivel to watch TV in bed or on the couch, but we were always worried we'd knock the TV over since it was a bit in the way. Breakfast is provided everyday. Continental - pastries, cereal, fresh juices, fruit and coffee/tea. A good selection, but just a warning - no hot food. Cakes are served in the afternoon, and wine in the evening in the lobby. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the Causeway Bay MTR station, and there are plenty of restaurants nearby. There is a Din Tai Fung right across the street! The staff gave excellent advice on how to visit some of Hong Kong's popular sites, including the escalators, Kowloon night market, and how to get to Macau. While we don't have any complaints, we didn't give 5 stars for a few reasons: there is no restaurant, the elevators can be a bit slow, the views from the room were poor, the hallways and elevators were very dark (perhaps deliberate). These issues are minor, and definitely did not take away from the overall experience of staying at JIA.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel in an exciting town...!”
Reviews.Author: JDKL_MEL
Reviews.Content: Having not been to Hong Kong before my family and I were very much looking forward to our stay at the JIA Boutique hotel. We had a top floor penthouse suite and found this to be great! The penthouse was very spacious with two decent sized bedrooms downstairs (I had heard that hotel rooms in Hong Kong were very small but didn't find this to be the case here) with two bathrooms (2 showers and a bath). The living areas were upstairs with an adequate kitchen with full-sized fridge, dining area, lounge area and a large day bed. There are also laundry facilities in the room, however it was very easy to get laundry sent out and ready for collection the following day. There was a very good sound system and dvd player set-up in the lounge area and both bedrooms and the lounge had flat screen tv's. The location was great, close to shops and only a short walk to the MTR which is a very impressive railway system. We were able to use the MTR to get to the ladies market, Disneyland and a few other places. It was so easy and efficient and safe to travel on at any hour of the day. There is a complimentary continental breakfast offered daily in the lobby and water and soft drinks available from the lobby all day also. We really had no need to buy anything from the nearby 7-eleven as it was mostly all provided. They also have happy hour from 6.30pm in the lobby every night with complimentary wine served. As the JIA does not have its own gym I made the short five minute walk to utilise the nearby complimentary membership facilities (gold pass available from reception) at the California Fitness gym. Most days however, it was fun to jog/walk around nearby Victoria Park with the locals. I guess the only thing lacking at the JIA is a swimming pool but we were too busy to really notice it. The staff at the JIA were lovely and always greeted myself and family by name and were always friendly and helpful with directions and information. I would definitely recommend a stay at the JIA Boutique hotel. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Noulou
Reviews.Content: They have bed bugs and they pretend they didn't know what it was...seriously and you're a hotel in an international city? Don't stay there

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: perrin99
Reviews.Content: This is a boutique place in a great location. We booked the studio room which was more than enough space for our 4 days in HK. Breakfast is basic but good and it will help you start your day. Staff has very helpful for booking massages and giving directions, they let you borrow umbrella's for the day (very useful during the month of June). JIA is close to Jardine's Bazaar (do try Mak's Noodles and Man Fai on this street).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: azgirl87
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Jia Hotel over New Years this year, and the hotel has a nice atmosphere and helpful staff. The hotel is near many different activities you can walk to, times sqaure on new years eve was about ten minutes away :)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: AdvisorMember12
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. I had the pleasure of staying here in November when I accompanied my boyfriend on business. The location is excellent for exploring, close to restaurants, shopping and the subway. The rooms are clean, modern and beautifully designed. Really, it's amazing what they've done with the space given. We stayed for over a week and never once felt short on space. Breakfast is excellent and served on the main floor with a good selection of cereals, fruit, pastries and excellent coffee. They also offer complimentary cake in the afternoon and wine in the evening. Free laundry and a patio for relaxing is available as well. It's the little things that make you feel at home and Jia goes over and above. Staff are friendly, helpful and knowledgeable about the area. Just loved it here. I'll certainly book again the next time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: divinedoc
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at this charming hotel after a conference. Stayed at the Penthouse on the top floor which could accomodate five of us. Wonderful location close to Causeway bay MTR and the Shopping malls. Quaint lobby with unusual furniture. Lovely penthouse with high end audio visual equipment . Bedrooms were quite small. Breakfast was served just next to the lobby. Complimentary beverages with snacks were available round the clock at the lobby. Wine was served for a couple of hours in the evening. Service was awesome!! All in all made our weekend memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable gem on northeast Hong Kong Island.”
Reviews.Author: ljnicholson
Reviews.Content: Jia was a great find for us, with a location in a fun little shopping district in northeast Hong Kong, close to the subway for easy access to a all the sights. The rooms are compact studios with all space used thoughtfully and efficiently to accommodate a seating area for TV and relaxation, closets/drawers to unpack, a desk for the free internet and our piles of maps and tour books, a comfortable bed, and a great little kitchenette with dishes and pots for cooking. There's free laundry, a nice outdoor patio seating area, and a great continental breakfast each morning. Service is extremely friendly and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “Central & Chirpy!”
Reviews.Author: mccheah
Reviews.Content: I was relatively surprised to find an interesting set up of this nature right smacked in the middle of bustling Causeway Bay. The room was overall fairly comfortable, certainly not one to choose if you were planning to stay in to enjoy the facilities. However its location well made up for it, especially if it is really just for a good night's rest. Most taxi drivers do not know the exact location so best to tell them it (Jia is just around the corner) is near Pennington Road or Regal Hotel. It is centrally located in a fantastic shopping area with great places to eat and the MTR just a stone's throw away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but needs a makeover”
Reviews.Author: 2friendstravelling
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a one bedroom suite which was very spacious for HK standards. Managed to get a last minute rate which was reasonable but not sure that the full price rate is good value for the hotel in it's current state. As per previous reviews Jia has a great concept, being a lovey little boutique hotel with Phillipe Starke design, however, the rooms are unfortunately worn and look in need of updating. The white lounges had a slightly grey tired tinge to them and there was a slightly (not terribly unpleasant) musty smell in the room. The bathroom was clean but again looked a touch tired. Having said that, the location is awesome, in the middle of the action and great for anyone new to HK who wants to explore. The shops in Causeway Bay are a minute away and open until late, lots of great little eateries on your doorstep, incling Din Tai Fung, the famous dumpling cafe literally across the road. MTR station 3 mins away. Beware, though, as it's a small hotel many taxi drivers do not know of it or how to get there! Staff were helpful, loved the little area in the foyer for breafast and drinks. Liked having a little kitchen in the room to make coffee and snacks. I would have liked to stay here when the Hotel was newer, but it is now in need at least a new coat of paint and new covers for the soft furnishings. Would unfortunately not go back or recommend until that had happened, unless you can secure a good discount on the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but tired and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: dmoutsop
Reviews.Content: Simply put, Jia was not worth the price. We stayed at Jia in the penthouse with three friends (there were two bedrooms and an extra bed in the living room). Even though we split the cost and all piled into the penthouse, we still paid what we would have for a 4 star or above luxury hotel. It doesn't feel like a hotel, but more like serviced apartments. The lobby is small and sort of quiet - though it is a plus that they have free continental breakfast, and coffee, tea, water and juice throughout the day. The rooms are tired and worn - really minimalist but not in a good way. Staff was just sort of 'there' - not overly welcoming, nor all that accomodating. When we asked for some help with dinner reservations, they obliged, but again - not the extent of service I would expect from the consierge at a luxury hotel. The location saved the day for us - it is a great location and we walked to everything. When we go back to Hong Kong - we won't be staying at Jia. Not unless they lower their prices in keeping with the class of hotel it truly is. It isn't good value for money. I would rather pay the same price to stay at a full-service, modern luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Once a trendy boutique hotel, but slowly in decline”
Reviews.Author: NuNu1980
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Jia as it reviewed as an interesting boutique hotel with a good restaurant and was close to town and shopping. There are no complaints about location, it was really handy to good shopping at Times Square and had a great dim sum restaurant over the road (1 michelin star). The hotel was also pretty well priced for Hong Kong. We noticed immediately though that it was getting a bit tired, the rooms were ageing. They were big rooms for Hong Kong, but we did book a suite. The bed bas really hard and relatively uncomfortable. But staff were really great, friendly and accommodating - we got up late most mornings and the cleaning lady was always happy to do our room in the afternoon. The in-house restaurant is no longer michelin starred - and that is a fair call, the food was ok, but not michelin star quality. I fear that the hotel is making a gradual decline to average hotel and has lost its new, trendy boutique shine. I would recommend this hotel to a friend based on price and location, but I would not pick it as a boutique option in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: Bama-AND-Dylan
Reviews.Content: I can't rave about this hotel enough. I can't quite believe its cost for what it is, it's truly a superb find and if I ever have the pleasure of going back to HK, I will stay here without doubt. Staff were very friendly and gave good advice about the area and what to do. The location is fantastic near all the good night spots and train links - excellent shopping area also. The breakfast is lovely and although it's served in a small space, it totally delivers - which is the essence of this hotel. They make the impossible happen in the space they have. I'll get to the rooms in a moment but they also do free wine in the evening from 7-8 which is a really nice touch as the people staying here are couples, normally getting ready for an evening out so this is a great start. The design of the hotel is very Stark, Schrager esque. Designed beautifully, almost like it's on show. Now the rooms are the best part (as if the rest isn't enough - it nearly is), they are a little design heaven. Bose system in the rooms for you ipod, a cordoned off area with a large, incredibly comfortable bed behind sheer drapes, quirky design features all over the place to keep you busy for the first 30 mins in the room, till you find the mini bar and decide it's all too much and you're so excited you need a drink. I loved this place so I really can't rave about it enough, if you can stay here, DO.

Reviews.Title: “Looks cheap, tacky and tired”
Reviews.Author: quevara
Reviews.Content: We were in HK for a week and we did consider staying here. In the end, we stayed at The Upper House in Pacific Place so I cannot comment on the rooms at Jia. We did have a walk through their lobby and reception area when we were in the area one night and I was glad we didn't stay here! Lobby and reception was small, cramped and the layout was inexplicably non user friendly. Starcke's furniture might look amazing in photos or on Jia's website, but in real life looks dated and kitsch. The lobby had an odd assortment of his furniture and it just looked tacky and strange, like I was at a second hand furniture market stall. I am not knocking his design pieces by the way because I have 2 of his Ghost chairs at home but I just didn't think it worked at Jia. The reception check in area is tiny and manned by one person. My whole impression was that Jia is definitely not a 5 star hotel and I find it difficult to conceive that Starcke would give his name to this hotel, given its location, layout and finish.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with lots of bonus features”
Reviews.Author: 1772_on_the_road
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Jia at the end of November 2010. We loved the decor (modern and interesting in the public areas) and the small cozy feel of the hotel. There are only three rooms per floor which gives you a sense of the scale of the building. All the flooring in the public rooms and suites is hardwood which we really prefer over the carpet most North Amercian hotels use. Given the price (not bad) we were surprised how relatively large the rooms are - a small kitchenette, a seating area, with desk and a separate bed area. The little kitchenette was a real bonus - in the middle of the night, suffering from terrible jet lag, I was able to brew up a cup of french press cofffe (all provided) - what a treat! The complimentary breakfast, afternoon tea and cake and early evening wine were fantastic. The area is great - we especially liked the easy access to the metro train system and the nearby Sogo department store! Lots of good restaurants too. It is noisy in this part of Hong Kong... but our room was on the 8th floor and I was able to sleep without earplugs.... There can be an issue with noise between the suites... the walls did seem rather thin - it affect only two of the three units on each floor - the third unit is more isolated and the noise doesn't travel.

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel, great staff but rooms are tired”
Reviews.Author: cha1984
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights on holiday and really enjoyed the location; there was so much to do right on your door step which, unlike the larger chain hotels based in Central, was nice about JIA. However, the website makes the hotel look alot more sleek than it really is. My room was tired, there was a musty smell in the bedroom, the bathroom had a strange orange stain down the tiles, and there was a lot of dust. I could also here the bell from the lift everytime someone went in or out of it! I wouldn't say I was disappointed with the hotel but I would probably stay some where else next time. I definitely would not stay here if I was on business. I must say thought, the staff were exceptional. Breakfast consists of muffins, juice & coffee.... not great but they do offer complimentary drinks throughout the day which you don't get in most hotels. Overall a good hotel, not quite what it makes out to be but a fun place for a holiday in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy- Worn and Tired”
Reviews.Author: Peachtreec
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights, booked directly off of the website for the cheapest rates. While it is boutique and decorated by a famous designer, the furnishings were starting to look a little worn and not necessarily maintained well (main entrance gray-silver chair had threads thinning and stains; white furnishing in the room was starting to look worn). The space was very small, but was smartly laid out to hide it. GOOD THINGS: - The nice part was the continental breakfast- cold items such as pastries, yogurt, juice and coffee. - great area for shopping - metro only 2 minute walk away - stylish furnishings - VERY courteous staff and very helpful! - internet without extra charge NOT SO GOOD THINGS: - The not so nice part, as mentioned by another reviewer- is that the AC is very noisy. I also stayed on the 9th floor and you could hear everything outside, especially a periodic vibration of something turning on every 15 minutes or so (if possible request a higher floor, that might help) - very congested area packed with people sitting on the grounds, steps, streets, everywhere - worn furnishings

Reviews.Title: “Nice design hotel, excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: Manthos
Reviews.Content: I just spent three nights in this HK hotel on a business trip. The overall impression has been positive. Liked: the location near the Causeway Bay subway station, the comfortable bed, the generous breakfast and drinks offered for free all day, the free WIFI, the staff who were friendly, knowledgeable and eager to help !!! Could do better: Single glazed windows mean street noise but at least you may open them if you, like me, dislike constant airconditioning. Limited choice of tv channels. No bathtubs. I would gladly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Solid 4 Star hotel with 5 Star service”
Reviews.Author: Paul A
Reviews.Content: Spent 14 nights here on business. I'm a self proclaimed high maintenance traveler who expects a lot. 4th time in Hong Kong and have always stayed in Central. Decide to stay in a non-traditional hotel. Here's my assessment: Pros: 1.There are 3 room types (3 rooms per floor). I stayed in the largest of the 3 -suite with king bed. It was refreshing to have a lot of space: separate bedroom, mini kitchen with frid, microwave, stove, lots of closet space. 2. Free internet (broadband and wireless options 3. Free continental breakfast 4. Free access to colas and fresh juices, tea, coffee 24/7 in the lobby. 5. Complimentary wine 6pm-8pm daily in lobby and small tea/cake service between 1 and 5pm daily. 6. Access to complimentary DVD 7. Surround sound in room with hookup to play iPod, CD, DVD.. 8. Flat screen in Living room and small flat screen in bedroom. 9. Can conference call (phone in room doesn't have speaker phone. I called lobby and they delivered and set up polycom phone in my room - free use. 10. Free access to California Fitness - very large extensive gym with good equipment; note that locks are not provided at the gym if you desire to use a locker, but if you ask the front desk at the hotel, they will loan you a lock and key. 11. Good bath products 12. Block away from Causeway Bay MTR station. 13. 2 washer and 2 dryers on site to do self laundry if desired 14. Menus to multiple restaurants in the area that will deliver to your room (10% surcharge). 15. Two air conditioning units: bedroom and living room. Cons: 8 minutes walk to gym (not on site) Shower head is not movable Lighting in the room is a little on the dim side; if you need bright lights in the bathroom, you may be annoyed. Be aware that booking well in advance (2 months if possible) yields much better pricing than waiting only a few weeks before your arrival.

Reviews.Title: “A quirky boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: saratogadxb
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the JIA hotel in Hong for 3 nights and it's a good value hotel that is well located. The hotel is quirky and different and has a nice atmosphere and decor. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. Each night the hotel offers free drinks for a couple of hours which is a good time to catch up with friends and regroup before evenings out.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Shaowei
Reviews.Content: Nice selection of breakfast, efficient usage of limited space in room, very helpful service, very fun location where there's lots of shops and eateries open till 11pm. No bathtub in room.

Reviews.Title: “Hip boutique hotel to stay in HK”
Reviews.Author: elyadimple
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a friend of mine in June 2010. The hotel was booked for us by a company, so I am not exactly sure what the rate was. 2 of us stayed in one room and we didn't mind share one bed, it was big enough for 2 people. I loved stereo system in the room, I could hook up my iPod and sound quality was Amazing! Free internet was a big plus. Bathroom area with a shower was little bit small, but ok. Hotel is rather small, but tall. I think we stayed on 20th floor and as far as i understood there were only 2 rooms on each floor. I loved wine hour everyday for free and free breakfast in the morning. I usually went around 9.30 am and at that time it was not too crowded. Because if it gets crowded there could be an issue with space, because it is served in a lobby. I also loved water/snacks availability in the lobby downstairs all day long. I would usually grab a bottle of water as I leave hotel, it was very convenient. I would recommend it for younger people. Rooms are not too big, but I think designed well to accommodate all needs. Location is good too: pretty close to subway and walking distance to Times Square for shopping! Good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: aliglobetrek
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in a studio in mid September. I really liked this hotel. We loved the location as it is a buzzing area with loads of shops and restaurants close by and is also close to the metro. The rooms were very cosy and stylish and the staff were very helpful and friendly. I loved the layout of the lobby as you got talking to other guests. The complimentary breakfast, soft drinks throughout the day and wine from 6 till 8 were a nice added extra. Overall I thought the hotel was very good value for money compared to the ridiculous prices I was quoted for other hotels in Hong Kong. I would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish & Affordable”
Reviews.Author: FGraz
Reviews.Content: Let's face it, if you don't have an expense account, accommodations in Hong Kong can pretty daunting. The Jia Boutique Hotel is a funky alternative to high-end hotels chains. It's affordable, stylish, and designed to please ... both the eye and the pocketbook.

Reviews.Title: “Had one of the best hotel experiences here!”
Reviews.Author: rajivk11
Reviews.Content: Extremely friendly and courteous staff. The hotel has studios and suites. Although, I booked a studio, I got upgraded to a suite with separte, living dinig, bedroom and pantry. The rooms are nice clean and very well designed. The lobby is small, but very well designed. The hotel offers continetal breakfast in the morning and one can go down and grab a juice, coffee or tea at anytime of the day. The cappucino from the coffee machine was quite nice. The afternoon cakes were quite nice. Althought we missed it, they do serve wine in the evening at the lobby as well. The hotel has two restaurants, a casual tapas restaurant on the ground floor and a formal, michelin star Italian restaurant (called the Drawing Room) with a separate entrance on the first floor. Tried both, but I think one can give it a miss (especially the Drawing room) Book early to get a good deal. Free Wi-Fi Overall, I would highly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Ladybug_on_the_way
Reviews.Content: Although shorte on space, the hotel is beautyfully decorated in a very modern way. Rooms are not spacious but are very well put together. We were there for two nights in the middle of a typhoon and we couldn't leave the hotel. The staff was more than helpfull in lending us DVDs so we could kill time. The only downside is that the hotel doesn't have a restaurant. It would be fine otherwise (I don't like having dinner in hotels), but if you're stuck with a typhoon, it's quite an adventure to go out and have dinner.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a hotel - a poor value serviced apartment with no substantive facilities.”
Reviews.Author: gadflyer
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite here so we could relax and enjoy the last day of our tour across China with a little bit of Hong Kong luxury. Sadly it was the worst experience of accommodation and value for money on our journey - we'd stayed in five star palaces through to mountain side hostels. With a room with breakfast rate at $1795HK (£180) plus 10 per cent service we had high expectations. The "suite" is really the size of a large hotel room and they have squeezed a lot in - you hit the wall as you leave your bed and the shower door misses the toilet by 1cm. The Phillipe Stark decor was probably cool in 2007 but now looks a bit Ikea. Air con unit in the bedroom was right above the bed - so we were left to choose between hot and quiet or cool and noisy. The sign saying "Dream" above the bed was optimistic. The worst part of the bedroom was the nasty musty smell which we first noticed when we came back after our night out - possibly air con related. It got worse through the night. So we headed downstairs hoping a good breakfast would set us up for our last day in Hong Kong. First we had to negotiate the lifts. One made it to us with space for us after a five minute wait. We considered taking the stairs but one look behind the door and we had second thoughts - a nasty smell again and all sorts of junk on the stairs. So finally down in the lobby and there was "breakfast". Self- served by the many guests from a frankly dangerous work area of approx 3ft by 2ft. One two slice toaster and one coffee machine serving tens of guests. And oh yes - we ate on the lobby floor because there aren't enough seats. I reckon Mr Stark would be having kittens at the impracticality of it all. By the time I'd got a bit of toast cooked the breakfast "service" was shut down. I expressed my disgust to the manager who said she's never heard of problems with room smells before (Strange - I've just read a similar complaint here on tripadvisor) She took $400Hk off the room cost but we were still charged tax on the original $1795. We left hungry and feeling conned.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, Fabulous great little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bg82
Reviews.Content: I travel for a living, staying in beautiful hotels and never review them, this is a first! Hotel Jia was perfect for our trip to Hong Kong. The staff were absolutely superb and could not do enough to make you feel welcome. The hotel was spotless, and located in the heart of Causeway Bay - 2 minutes from Time Square, SOGO dept store and the MTR. With a personal boutique feel, tasteful decor and a warm friendly feel I would have no hesitation in recommending JIA.

Reviews.Title: “Wowwwww, thats all that I can...”
Reviews.Author: blinkfxpx
Reviews.Content: Wowwwww, thats all that I can say! amazing rooms, staff and hotel. Decorated by Phillipe Starck, super modern/art deco, it was so incredible that we never left the hotel before 12pm. Take advantage of the freebies in the dining area, they are free all they long!

Reviews.Title: “Small... yet perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: Stefanski
Reviews.Content: The JIA Hotel is a modern boutique hotel located in the Causeway Bay area of Hong Kong. On arrival I was somewhat dissappointed as the hotel is located in a rather unexceptional building, however, this is the only thing unexceptional about the hotel. The service from the front desk staff, indeed all the staff we encountered during our stay, was extraordinarily polite, friendly and professional, and we were quickly shown to our room. The room is small - remember this is Hong Kong - but designed to cater for all your needs. From mini bar to ironing board, hair dryer to Wifi (free by the way), cable tv to work station the room had everything one would expect of a much more expensive hotel. In the guest lounge area there was a range of complimentary coffee and soft drinks available all day, complimentary wine available between 6 - 7 pm. Breakfast was also taken in this area, a simple self service continental affair yet very well done. The hotel is only a short walk to Wanchai Star Ferrry Terminal, with easy access to Kowloon, and also the tram system providing low cost transport across Hong Kong. The JIA was a very welcome change from the sterile 'business' hotels that one might normally book and I would recommend it wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in a convenient part of Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Niagaranomad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 days in Hong Kong and while the haze/pollution wasn't co operative we still managed to squeeze in as many sights,sounds and tastes of the island. We opted for Jia to receive a little more personalized service and were not disappointed. We were allowed to check into our suite ( which we highly recommend in spite of the extra cost) at 7:30 am which was great after our 15 hr flight. It was like getting an extra day and we were even offered breakfast. We could see that some breakfast times were crowded but somehow we managed to avoid them. The assortment of food was more than adequate. The evening complimentary wine was always a good start to our night out. The staff was extremely quick and helpful whenever we had questions or needed directions and there were no hitches with our complimentary internet service. If we had one concern it was that our bedroom had a slight musty smell - likely due in part to the 90%+ humidity throughout our stay. The location in Causeway Bay gave us easy access to the MTR a wide range of restaurants and markets . In addition my favourite street in the city (Jardine's Bazaar) was right across the street. We used the door to door bus service from the airport on arrival and a taxi and MTR airport express for departure. Both methods cost about the same (approx. $35.00 total for 2 people). If we were to return to Hong Kong we would definitely consider this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “JIA - Doesn't get any better than this!”
Reviews.Author: walkerae
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a week in Hong Kong and 6 nights at Jia in Causeway Bay, I felt compelled to write a review for fellow travelers thinking of staying here. Don't think twice, just book it. Much like the Claska in Tokyo and the New Majestic in Singapore, the Jia is an individual, styled boutique hotel slap bang in the trendiest part of town. If you are familiar with Phillipe Stark, this is another of his creations (akin to the Hudson Hotel in New York). From the minute the taxi pulls up with our luggage, to the minute we are packed back in one again, the staff and the service are exemplary. The Lobby is the first main talking point; very Stark and very inviting. Here they serve FREE 24 hour fresh juices, water etc, FREE continental breakfast each morning, FREE afternoon cakes and coffees and FREE evening wine. Please note the word FREE, because what other hotel (particularly the monstrous corporate chain ones) would ever offer anything for free? Along with the FREE broadband access, FREE local calls, FREE gym passes, FREE DVD library, FREE entry into top nightclubs, bars, harbour cruises and discount dining - they should have renamed this hotel FREE. You may get the impression that I enjoyed my stay here. That doesn't even come close. I could not find fault with one thing. Having enjoyed all the above, I only paid for the daily rate on check out and no hidden extras. Try that at the Hyatt. It saved us a fortune. Yes the rooms are compact, but they are cleverly laid out. This is Asia, where floor space is at a premium. If you want a bigger room, that's a worry. Hong Kong is such an amazing place you should not want to sit in your room! The bed was heavenly comfortable (that might also have something to do with my beautiful companion!), the home theatre system was a nice touch and the toiletries (which are constantly replenished) luxurious. The friendly staff were always there to help navigate around the city, suggest and book restaurants (note, Hutong at 1 Peking Road for incredible views and authentic top class Chinese, Dragon-I for the best in stylish clubbing and Top Deck at Jumbo for the best sundowner in town). The hotel is undoubtedly situated in the best part of the city; right in the middle of Causeway Bay on Hong Kong Island and 3 mins walk to the MTR. There are amazing local eateries on the strip to the underground and lots of boutique style shopping around the side streets. Make time for G.O.D and certainly have brunch in their cafe next door (Habitu), when you need a change from noodles and dim sum. Jia is home from home but also cool enough to feel like you are staying somewhere special. So much so that a love was reignited at exactly half way.

Reviews.Title: “Almost faultless!”
Reviews.Author: JadsMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Having read some good reviews here, expectations were on the high side and we were not let down. A stylish and modern hotel in a great location. Rooms were spotless and very well appointed. My best advice if you want a bit more space is to spend a little more and get the one bedroom suite as we did. Perfect for two or even one person who just needs a litte more room. There is a little bit of street noise in the early hours but I didn't find it a bother at all. The staff are very welcoming and friendly, without being over the top or pretentious in the slightest. This is the best kind of service: understated but friendly and efficient. The complimentary things such as umbrellas (and we needed them!) DVDs, the afternoon wine and fridge stocked with Juice, water and so on are a great touch. Often things that you would simply not get at larger hotels without paying extra. Top tips: - Be sure to try the brilliant - and new - tapas bar\restaurant right next door called Madera. Great service and the food was sublime. As good as I have had in any tapas bar around the world!! - Sometimes the breakfast area at the hotel is quite busy and taking things back to your room is tricky. But if you want to skip that and go out for breakfast, the Soho district in the mid levels is not far away and full of great breakfast spots. Don't expect breakfast service much before 10\10.30 in Soho however. Overall, I would definetely stay at Jia again. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Sleek, and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: earthjaunt
Reviews.Content: For a hotel that cannot offer much in the way of extra services, this place is still a gem. Smack in the middle of Causeway Bay, minutes walk to Victoria Park, with easy access to public transport, the Jia has a really nice atmosphere. It is a little oasis in the middle of a very busy place. The rooms are small but cozy and well-laid out. The beds are comfortable. The TV works, the internet access is solid, and I've enjoyed each visit. If you want to use a gym, you can go running in Victoria Park or go to California Fitness five blocks away (the hotel has a complimentary use pass for this). Each room comes with a little hotplate/kitchenette and a well-stocked mini-bar. After work the hotel offers free wine-tasting and snacks in the lobby, and in the mornings, continental breakfast. In all, for a business traveler who wants something different from your standard big brand hotel, it's a nice change.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely to look at, difficult to stay in”
Reviews.Author: JXJG
Reviews.Content: The Jia is a fine example of turn-of-the-century interior design. It has Phillippe Stark whimsy is sprayed all over it and makes for a good photo spread in a coffee table book. However, the three-dimensional reality is another matter. Staying at the Jia is a forceful reminder that the ‘less is more’ philosophy has considerable merit, especially when small spaces are involved. A small L-shaped room plus a desk, a chair, two coffee tables, a day bed, a television on a unit (in the middle of the room), a double bed, two bedside tables, slim cupboards, lots of lamps, a curtainy room-divider, two average sized humans, two average sized suitcases, and two average sized cabin bags adds up to one big Chinese Puzzle or game of Tetris. Sure, this is fun at first. It quickly becomes wearisome, especially if your companion insists on moving around the room at the same time you do. If you do visit, bring ear plugs: in our room the air conditioning unit was just above the bed and cheerfully rattled all night long. And if you are afraid of small dark places – like coffins – plan to avoid the elevators. On the up side, the lobby is pretty and airy and the free food and drinks (albeit limited in variety) are a nice touch. The reception staff seemed well versed in the art of avoiding people - they spent a lot of the time doing busy things behind sweeping red curtains – and so you can have the lobby pretty much to yourself. And the location isn’t bad; it is just five minutes from Causeway Bay MTR and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel in a lively neighbourhood in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Finnish_female
Reviews.Content: We stayed at JIA for 5 nights in Dec 2009-Jan 2010 based on local friends' recommendation. The hotel was very good: great location near Causeway Bay MTR station, good shopping and eating possibilities next to the hotel. The decoration is very "boutique like" in the lobby and in the rooms - I loved all the small details which made the place so "hip"! The floor plan of our room, 1001, was probabaly not the best one as the room did not feel very spacious, at least compared with rooms in many other major cities. Everything was, however, carefully planned so it really did not bother us, and in Hong Kong space is expensive so we knew that the room will not be a huge one.
